question.body: Which of the following contains fully oxygenated blood?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The superior vena cava carries oxygen-poor blood from the body back to the heart to be transported to the lungs.
Incorrect. The inferior vena cava carries oxygen-poor blood from the body back to the heart to be transported to the lungs.
Correct. The pulmonary veins bring oxygen-rich blood from the lungs to the left atria of the heart.
Incorrect. The pulmonary arteries carry oxygen-poor blood from the right ventricle to the lungs.
